pages.text: The $(item)Tool Belt/$ can be used to keep your tools (or any non-stackable item) oprganized. When it is in the $(thing)Curios/$ belt slot, hold $(bold)$(k:toolbelt.open)/$ to access the radial menu to swap tools in and out of the belt.$(br2)The $(item)Tool Belt/$ starts with 2 slots, but can be upgraded by applying $(item)Belt Pouches/$ at an $(item)Anvil/$.
The $(item)Wrench/$ is one of the most useful tools you can have while building contraptions, as it lets you easily pick up or rotate mechanical blocks. See the item tooltip for more information.
$(item)Metal Sheets/$ can be created using the $(bold)$(item)$(l:getting_started/devices#press)Mechanical Press/$.

The $(item)Engineer's Goggles/$ let you see more information about mechanical devices and systems when looking at them, such as stress generation and consumption. The goggles can be worn either in the helmet slot or in the $(thing)Curios/$ head slot.

$(item)Superglue/$ can be used to attached blocks together when building $(bold)$(l:contraptions)Contraptions/$.$(ponder)$(br2)$(item)Slime Balls/$ can be crafted to save you the trouble of finding slimes early on.

$(item)Bundles/$ can be used to store different types of items in the same inventory slot, up to a single stack. Note that items with a stack size of less than 64 will count proportionally based on their stack sizes.$(br2)$(item)Seed Pouches/$ work in a similar manner, but can only store $(item)Seeds/$. However, they are able to store up to 10 stacks of $(item)Seeds/$.
The $(item)Trowel/$ will randomly place blocks from your hotbar when used, making it great for adding variation to builds.
Using a $(item)Bucket/$ on a $(thing)Tiny Slime/$ will capture it in the bucket. It will then begin jumping inside the bucket while you are in a $(thing)Slime Chunk/$.

Using a $(item)Bottle/$ at cloud level (Between Y level 192 and 196) will get you a $(item)Cloud in a Bottle/$, which can be used to place temporary blocks in the air. They are non-solid and will disappear after a few seconds, but placing a block on it will instead replace the cloud. The $(thing)Cloud/$ will return to the $(item)Bottle/$ when you do this.

The $(item)Abacus/$ can be sued for measuring distances, up to 48 blocks. Use $(bold)$(k:use)/$ on a block to select it with the $(item)Abacus/$ and it will begin measuring the total distance along all axes from that block to the block you are looking at.
